Job Title: Field Engineer with Security Clearance

Location: King of Prussia, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Number 662694BR Description:This position is an opportunity to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment supporting a Navy combat system. In this role the candidate will become a member of an established lab team working in the Syracuse test facility. The candidate will be required to learn how to perform and conduct customer witnessed system sell-off testing. In addition, the candidate will be supporting all other lab activities as required. Here are a few examples of what the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to: 1) Installation of cabinet systems in the Syracuse test facility. a. This involves but is not limited to cabling, loading software, fault diagnoses, and uninstalling the system post testing.

 Administrative duties as it pertains to the following activities. Hardware security, test equipment tracking, purchase requisitions, equipment moves. Conduct system level customer witnessed testing using established test procedures. Fiber Topology using established procedures and test equipment. Perform other duties as assigned by the lab lead (i.e. Engineering change installation, general lab organization, support other lab team members).

Most of the work will be conducted in the Syracuse Test Facility, but some domestic or international travel will be required on an as needed basis.

Basic Qualifications:

 Domestic travel and or international travel to low, medium, and high-risk security level countries is required. 2) Demonstrated skills in electronic and mechanical troubleshooting. 3) Demonstrated skills following established test procedures. 4) Proficient using MS Office Software including; Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook. 5) Demonstrated skills utilizing different pieces of test equipment like a Digital Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer, or a Signal Generator to name a few. 6) Qualified candidate must be able to obtain a DoD Interim Secret Security Clearance prior to starting this position. This requires US Citizenship.

Desired Skills:

 Previous field engineering and equipment support experience in support of a defense program. 2) Previous Military experience performing maintenance and operation of AN/SQQ-89 system. 3) Knowledge and understanding of SONAR Theory, Design, Troubleshooting, and Repair. 4) Understanding of Unix/Linux operating system in the areas of file system navigation and commands. 5) Fiber Optics repair/cleaning/polishing 6) Working knowledge of local area networks and associated hardware (i.e. switches)

Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.

Clearance Level: Secret
